title: Shelvey earns Newcastle vital win at Leeds
shortDescription: FREE TO WATCH: Highlights from Newcastle's win against Leeds in the Premier League.

title: Buendia header sinks Everton
shortDescription: Highlights from Aston Villa's win against Everton in the Premier League.

title: Late Rashford strike stuns West Ham and puts Man Utd fourth
shortDescription: Marcus Rashford was the hero for Manchester United as his stoppage-time goal saw them beat West Ham 1-0 and leap above the Hammers into fourth.

title: Aston Villa in talks with Juve over Bentancur
shortDescription: Aston Villa are in talks with Juventus over a move for Rodrigo Bentancur, with the Serie A side valuing the defensive midfielder at around £16m.

title: Buendia header dampens Everton's new start
shortDescription: Emi Buendia's header put a dampener on Everton's first game under Duncan Ferguson, although Aston Villa's 1-0 win was marred when two players were hit by a bottle.

title: Drone stops play at Brentford vs Wolves
shortDescription: The Premier League match between Brentford and Wolves was stopped due to an "unofficial drone" flying above the Brentford Community Stadium.

title: Blackstenius: I'm ready for new challenge at Arsenal
shortDescription: Stina Blackstenius speaks exclusively to Sky Sports about being "ready for a new challenge" after joining Arsenal Women this month.

title: Forest floor Rams in feisty East Midlands derby
shortDescription: Nottingham Forest strengthened their push for promotion from the Sky Bet Championship with a feisty 2-1 East Midlands derby victory over Derby.

title: Bristol City prevail in Severnside derby
shortDescription: Chris Martin netted a double as Bristol City came from behind to earn Severnside derby bragging rights with a 3-2 Championship win over Cardiff at Ashton Gate.

title: Fan arrested after Digne and Cash struck by bottle at Everton
shortDescription: A fan has been arrested after Lucas Digne and Matty Cash were both struck by a bottle as they celebrated Aston Villa's opener at Everton.

title: Xhaka on red cards: This is who I am - I take risks
shortDescription: Granit Xhaka insists he won't change the way he plays despite recent criticism for his red card against Liverpool.

title: Parry: We'll work night and day to find Derby solution
shortDescription: Football League chairman Rick Parry has told Sky Sports there is a willingness to "work night and day to find a solution" to Derby's financial problems.

title: All of Saturday's scores and fixtures
shortDescription: Catch up with all the scores from all Saturday's games across the Premier League, EFL, Scottish Cup and around Europe.

title: Why Sanchez is enjoying life under 'demanding' Conte
shortDescription: Tottenham defender Davinson Sanchez speaks exclusively to Sky Sports about life under "demanding" Antonio Conte and the "euphoric celebrations" at Leicester.

title: Ashley suing Staveley for breaching terms of £10m loan
shortDescription: Mike Ashley is suing Amanda Staveley for £10m because she is alleged to have breached terms of a loan agreement.

title: Celtic's Maeda to miss Old Firm game after Japan call-up
shortDescription: Celtic will be without Daizen Maeda for February's league game against Rangers, leaving Giorgos Giakoumakis as their only available striker.

title: Hibs include buy-back clause in Boyle deal
shortDescription: Hibernian have included a buy-back clause as part of the deal to sell Martin Boyle to Saudi Arabian club Al-Faisaly.

title: Sargent's fantastic flick from all angles!
shortDescription: Norwich's Josh Sargent opened his Premier League account with a sublime flicked finish in their 3-0 win against relegation rivals Watford, but did he mean it?

title: Ranieri vows to fight on as Watford boss | Carra: I fear for him
shortDescription: Claudio Ranieri has vowed to fight on as Watford manager and has called on his players to change their mentality following their 3-0 home defeat to Norwich.

title: Rangers ease past Stirling Albion in Scottish Cup
shortDescription:
Alex Lowry scored a dream debut goal while James Tavernier scored and missed a
penalty as Rangers swept Stirling Albion 4-0 in the Scottish Cup.
